content.question: Which of the following best supports the claim that binding of <math alttext="m i R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>miRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>‑delta to the <math alttext="m i R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mtext>miRNA</mtext></mstyle></math> binding site inhibits translation of gene Q <math alttext="m R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: When the promoter for gene Q is altered, transcription is inhibited.

Translation of Q <math alttext="m R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is inhibited regardless of whether the <math alttext="m i R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>miRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> binding site sequence is altered.

Translation of Q <math alttext="m R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is inhibited in the absence of <math alttext="m i R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>miRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>‑delta.

When the <math alttext="m i R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>miRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> binding site sequence is altered, translation of Q <math alttext="m R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> occurs in the presence of <math alttext="m i R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>miRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-delta.
